fields.content:
FISHPass uses barrier information from the California Passage Assessment Database (PAD), and performs customized optimization analyses for targeting the removal, repair, or mitigation of diadromous fish passage barriers in California.
If you have questions, please contact info@cafishpassageforum.org
This decision support tool, developed by the California Fish Passage Forum, uses an optimization model designed to help identify the most cost-effective fish passage barriers for remediation.

Total: A complete barrier to fish passage for all anadromous species at all life stages at all range of flows.

Partial: Only a barrier to certain species or life stages.

Temporal: Only a barrier at certain flows.

Temporal & Partial: Only a barrier to certain species or life stages and only at certain flows.

Barrier passability quantifies the degree to which a barrier inhibits the dispersal of fish. Barrier passability is defined as the fraction of fish, in the range 0-1, that are able to pass through, over or around a barrier while migrating upstream.

fields.title: Contact
fields.content:
If you have updates to the barrier dataset, please contact the PAD Administrator.

Contact information for the PAD Administrator including tools available for submitting changes are available via www.calfish.org/pad/.
